trashday

Class TrashDayManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • trashday.TrashDayManager

  • public class TrashDayManager
extends Object
    Handles the core application logic. The TrashDaySpeechlet interprets the Intents from the user and calls appropriate methods in this class. Methods in this class interact with the user's pickup Schedule and select an appropriate Alexa SpeechletResponse.
    Author:
    J. Todd Baldwin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TrashDayManager(com.amazonaws.services.dynamodbv2.AmazonDynamoDBClient amazonDynamoDbClient)
      Create manager object to handle mapping user intents to application actions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrashDayManager

        public TrashDayManager(com.amazonaws.services.dynamodbv2.AmazonDynamoDBClient amazonDynamoDbClient)
        Create manager object to handle mapping user intents to application actions. Methods will usually perform some action on the user's pickup schedule and then will return verbal response from the classes in the trashday.ui.responses package.
        Parameters:
        amazonDynamoDbClient - AmazonDynamoDBClient connection for the Dynamo DB holding our schedule data.

    • Method Detail

      • flushIntentLog

        public void flushIntentLog(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
        Flush any intent log data that has accumulated in the current user's session attributes to their correct Dynamo DB item. Create a new sessionDao.
        Parameters:
        session - Session for this request

      • flushIntentLog

        public void flushIntentLog()
        Flush any intent log data that has accumulated in the current user's session attributes to their correct Dynamo DB item. Use the current sessionDao.

      • handleLaunchRequest

        public com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse handleLaunchRequest(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.LaunchRequest request,
                                                                         com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
        Respond when the user says "Open Trash Day"

        Use loadSchedule(SessionDao, DynamoDao) to load the pickup schedule from the user's Session or, if not available, from the Dyanamo DB.

        If no schedule available respond with instructions to add to the schedule.

        If there is an existing schedule, calculate and recite the next pickup time for all pickups in the schedule.

        Parameters:
        request - LaunchRequest Use the time this request was received from the user.
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Recite the next pickup times or note the schedule is missing/empty

      • handleUpdateScheduleRequest

        public com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse handleUpdateScheduleRequest(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.IntentRequest request,
                                                                                 com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)

      • handleTellNextPickupRequest

        public com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse handleTellNextPickupRequest(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.IntentRequest request,
                                                                                 com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
        Respond when the user asks for the next pickup time for one or all of the scheduled pickups.

        Use loadSchedule(SessionDao, DynamoDao) to load the pickup schedule from the Session or Dynamo DB, if it exists. Respond with instructions to add to the schedule if the schedule is missing or empty.

        If there is no requested pickup name, calculate and recite the next pickup time for all pickups in the schedule. If given a specific pickup name, just calculate and recite the next time for that pickup.

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest Use the time this request was received from the user.
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Recite the next pickup(s) time(s) or note the schedule is missing/empty

      • handleTellScheduleRequest

        public com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse handleTellScheduleRequest(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.IntentRequest request,
                                                                               com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
        Respond when the user asks to hear the entire pickup schedule.

        Use loadSchedule(SessionDao, DynamoDao) to load the pickup schedule from the Session or Dynamo DB, if it exists. Respond with instructions to add to the schedule if the schedule is missing or empty. Otherwise, recite the schedule to the user.

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest Use the time this request was received from the user.
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Recite the existing schedule or note the schedule is missing/empty

      • handleSetTimeZoneRequest

        public com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse handleSetTimeZoneRequest(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.IntentRequest request,
                                                                              com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
        Respond when the user tries to set the time zone.
        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest Use the time zone slot provided by this user request to find a correct TimeZone and store it for this suer.
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Complain and possibly send a Time Zone Help Card if the time zone information can't be mapped to a good TimeZone. If we get good time zone information, set it in the Alexa session and this user's Dynamo DB storage entry.

      • handleAddPickupRequest

        public com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse handleAddPickupRequest(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.IntentRequest request,
                                                                            com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
        Respond when the user adds a pickup time into the schedule.

        Use loadSchedule(SessionDao, DynamoDao) to load the pickup schedule from the Session or Dynamo DB, if it exists.

        If we find any missing or invalid data in the request, respond appropriately so the user can correct and try again.

        Use Schedule.addPickupSchedule(String, DayOfWeek, LocalTime) to add a named pickup at a given day-of-week and time-of-day (creating a new schedule if needed). Then save the updated schedule to Dynamo DB and let the user know the addition was made.

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest for this request
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Complain if any required data is missing or invalid. Otherwise, make the schedule addition and let the user know.

      • handleDeletePickupRequest

        public com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse handleDeletePickupRequest(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.IntentRequest request,
                                                                               com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
        Respond when the user deletes a specific pickup time.

        Use loadSchedule(SessionDao, DynamoDao) to load the pickup schedule from the Session or Dynamo DB, if it exists.

        If we get a specific pickup (name, day-of-week, and time-of-day), delete the one pickup time Schedule.deletePickupTime(String, DayOfWeek, LocalTime), save the schedule to Dynamo DB, and let the user know.

        If we find any missing or invalid data in the request, respond appropriately so the user can correct and try again.

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest for this request
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Remove an entire pickup or a specific pickup time from the schedule and let the user know. Otherwise, complain about any missing or invalid data from the user.

      • handleDeleteEntirePickupRequest

        public com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse handleDeleteEntirePickupRequest(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.IntentRequest request,
                                                                                     com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
        Respond when the user deletes an entire pickup.

        Use loadSchedule(SessionDao, DynamoDao) to load the pickup schedule from the Session or Dynamo DB, if it exists.

        If we find any missing or invalid data in the request, respond appropriately so the user can correct and try again.

        If we get only a pickup name from the user, Schedule.deleteEntirePickup(String), save the schedule to Dynamo DB, and let the user know.

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest for this request
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Remove an entire pickup from the schedule and let the user know. Otherwise, complain about any missing or invalid data from the user.

      • handleDeleteEntireScheduleRequest

        public com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse handleDeleteEntireScheduleRequest(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.IntentRequest request,
                                                                                       com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
        Respond when the user wants to delete the entire schedule.

        Use loadSchedule(SessionDao, DynamoDao) to load the pickup schedule from the Session or Dynamo DB, if it exists. If the schedule is already empty, let the user know it is already cleared.

        We require a confirmation from the user. So store confirmation data in the SessionDao to delete the entire schedule. Then ask the user to confirm the schedule delete.

        The user will respond with a Yes/No answer that will be handled by handleYesRequest(IntentRequest, Session). That handler will (or will not) perform the delete entire schedule action.

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest for this request
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        Remove an entire pickup from the schedule and let the user know. Otherwise, complain about any missing or invalid data from the user.
        See Also:
        handleYesRequest(IntentRequest, Session)

      • handleHelpRequest

        public com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse handleHelpRequest(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.IntentRequest request,
                                                                       com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
        Respond when the user says "Help"

        Respond with help for using the Trash Day application.

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest for this request
        session - Session for this Yes/No request
        Returns:
        Commands to Add, Delete, and Query the weekly pickup schedule.

      • handleYesRequest

        public com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse handleYesRequest(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.IntentRequest request,
                                                                      com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
        Respond when the user gives a Yes or No.

        For some interactions, our application needs to ask the user for a Yes/No answer. Specifically, handleDeleteEntireScheduleRequest) needs to ask, "Are you sure you want to delete the entire schedule?"

        When we ask the user a Yes/No question, we record in the session an intent corresponding to the question we asked (SESSION_ATTR_CONFIRM_INTENT) and a description of the action we're contemplating (SESSION_ATTR_CONFIRM_DESC).

        When the user gives a "Yes" response, we generate a specific response based on the SESSION_ATTR_CONFIRM_INTENT. We return helpful messages when a question has not already been asked or the code does not understand how to perform a given intent (code error).

        Parameters:
        request - IntentRequest for this request
        session - Session for this Yes/No request
        Returns:
        a generic "Cancelled" response or a perform a specific action corresponding to a previously stored intent

      • handleNoRequest

        public com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse handleNoRequest(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
        Respond when the user gives a No.

        For some interactions, our application needs to ask the user for a Yes/No answer. Specifically, handleDeleteEntireScheduleRequest) needs to ask, "Are you sure you want to delete the entire schedule?"

        When we ask the user a Yes/No question, we record in the session an intent corresponding to the question we asked (SESSION_ATTR_CONFIRM_INTENT) and a description of the action we're contemplating (SESSION_ATTR_CONFIRM_DESC).

        When the user gives a "No" response, we return a generic "Cancelled" response using the description from SESSION_ATTR_CONFIRM_DESC. We return a helpful message when a question has not already been asked.

        Parameters:
        session - Session for this Yes/No request
        Returns:
        a generic "Cancelled" response or a perform a specific action corresponding to a previously stored intent

      • handleExitRequest

        public com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletResponse handleExitRequest(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
        Respond when the user says "Stop" or "Cancel"

        If we had just asked the user a question, take a Stop/Cancel as a "No" answer. Cleanup and respond appropriately.

        Otherwise, simply exit with a "Goodbye" message.

        Parameters:
        session - Session for this request
        Returns:
        response for the Stop or Cancel intent
